top_categories.workout_context: Southern Cross Gravel's North Georgia mountain gravel, forest roads forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 100 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Southern Cross Gravel's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before March.
50ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
At mile 60 of 100, glycogen is gone. This workout teaches your body to produce watts on fumes.
At Southern Cross Gravel, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Southern Cross Gravel. Train it until it feels boring.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Southern Cross Gravel, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
5,000ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
5,000ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on punchy mountain gravel. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 5,000ft of climbing on punchy mountain gravel does to your power file on race day.
Two threshold sessions per week without the recovery cost of VO2max work. For 100 miles, sustainable FTP gains matter more than peak power.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Southern Cross Gravel’s 100 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Southern Cross Gravel demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride punchy mountain gravel at race-day cadence weekly. Expect: north georgia mountain gravel, forest roads, technical doubletrack. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 100 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and TT Threshold to prepare you for 100 miles of punchy mountain gravel in Dahlonega, Georgia.
